intro: Taraxacum korjakense, commonly known as the Korjak mountain dandelion, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Siberia and the Russian Far East. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant features a rosette of hairy, spoon-shaped leaves and produces a long, slender stem with a single flower head. Its yellow flowers develop into white, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Taraxacum korjakense is adapted to cold climates and is often found in alpine and subarctic environments.
